claim: Among female patients who came to the hospital in 1997 and were immediately followed at the outpatient clinic, the majority lived more than 20 kilometers from the hospital.
extra_info: female refers to sex = 'F'; came at the hospital in 1997 refers to year(Description) = '1997'; immediately followed at the outpatient clinic refers to Admission = '-'
reasoning: The claim references patients living 'more than 20 kilometers from the hospital,' but the database contains no columns related to distance, location, or address in any of its tables (Patient, Examination, Laboratory). This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA concept that cannot be verified from the available data.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand the available tables and columns.

input.description: List all tables in the database
Get full schema of all tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
Now I can see the schema. The claim mentions "lived more than 20 kilometers from the hospital" — I need to check if there's any column related to distance. Let me look at the Patient table columns more carefully. The columns are: ID, SEX, Birthday, Description, First Date, Admission, Diagnosis.

There is no column related to distance or location/address in any of the tables. The claim references "lived more than 20 kilometers from the hospital" which is a concept that doesn't exist in the database schema.
